Reviews.Title: “great moments..”
Reviews.Author: oea04
Reviews.Content: beatifull hotel..i haved stay twice time..very kind and good stuff....i was suprised cause the stuff in Resepionist remenber me after 8 months....i was wonder if there is a official site or a mail to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “instanbul travel”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: The location is exellent,we are able to walk to all the magor attractions in Istanbul, we save a lot of money by avoiding puplic transportation.good breakfast,very very clean.The staff was exellent very kind people,generous and helpfull,especially Zeki,Min'e and the other man who working in the morning with two other's(sorry i can't remember his name)

Reviews.Title: “Very good prime location”
Reviews.Author: Khalidsawalha
Reviews.Content: A prime location in the heart of Sultanahmet area in Istanbul. 5 to 10 mnts walk from most attractions, sights and the metro. The rooms are clean and well serviced, however the breakfast is boring and very poor and could be much better according to the room price ... Highly recommended for those who wants to be close to the most Visited Istanbul Attractions.

Reviews.Title: “this is not the hotel I reviewed in May 2010”
Reviews.Author: unclespoon
Reviews.Content: In May last year I reviewed the hotel Le Piano.... the owners of that hotel have since moved down the street to another building setting up the Arden Anex but keeping the reviews they had for the previous hotel!!... I consider this to be totally out of order and misrepresentative of my views.... the new hotel is completely different from Le Piano and my comments then in no way indicate the quality of the Arden.... I could question the owners intent.... I feel that tripadvisor should look into this matter... I am not offering any furhter comment on the Arden

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kyousuf
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Arden Anex City Hotel in Istanbul was wonderful! I was welcomed warmly by the Front Desk Manager, Ms. Mine Adivar, and helped by Hakan Ã–zkan. My room was comfortable, clean and it included decent breakfast. Ms. Mine Adivar was great in recommending places to eat authentic Turkish seafood; and to go sightseeing. I would highly recommend Arden Annex City Hotel for anyone that wants to stay in Sultanahmet neighborhood, as it is close to all the historical sites. K. Yousuf

Reviews.Title: “An oasis is a very busy city”
Reviews.Author: Kada35
Reviews.Content: 4 Nights and 5 days I thoroughly enjoyed my experience of Istanbul, made all the more pleasurable by staying in the Arden Anex City Hotel. This place has several things to recommend it. Access: Extremely easy from Ataturk Airport, take the metro to Zeytinburnu and change to the tram (drection Kabatas) getting off at Sultanahment. From Sabiha Gokcen, take the Havas bus to Taksim, then the funicular to Kabatas and from there the tram (Direction Zeytinburnu) and get off at Sultanahmet. The hotel is 3 minutes walk from Sultanahment station. or you could get a taxi, but with public transport this cheap and accessible why bother (unless you have lots of suitcases) Location Perfect, The hotel is super close to all the main sites, Topkapi Hagia Sofia, Yerebatan Cistern, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar but in saying that it is located off the main drag so it is very peaceful at night. The area immediately surrounding the hotel is known for it's booksellers and printing houses. (the first Turkish newspaper was founded just around the corner). Sirkeci Station (train) and Eminonu ferry terminal are just down the hill which gives you access to the Bosphorus, Golden Horn and the Asian side of the city. The main tramline that passes Sultahamet goes to Kabatas is excellent for exploring the Taksim and Istikal Cad area. Take the tram to Kabatas, then the funicular to Taksim, walk the length of Istikal Cad (shops and more shops) then you can either walk down the Karakoy (stopping off to see the Galata tower) or take the funicular to downhill and take the tram back across the Galata bridge to Sultanahmet. Ambience Comfortable and cozy are words that spring to mind Rooms Again comfortable and cozy, but also warm and clean with impeccable bathroom with shower, airconditioning, tv,. Beds are comfortable with a duvet and footblanket. The rooms are cleaned everyday and to a very high standard. Food: Breakfast is generous, plenty of tea and coffee along with all the other things that make a leisurely holiday breakfast, fruit, cereals, charcuterie, hot options. Lunch and dinner are available in the hotel, the menu is small-ish but more than acceptable. On our first night we ate there, but there are many options in the neighbourhood to explore (including a charming bufe across the street)

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: MaPPo
Reviews.Content: Very noisy rooms, very uncomfortable bad, not very clean, dangerous elevator with no closing door (work in progress). Hotel is situated into a very good area.. near ayasophya, blue mosque and turistic attraction. Staff is nice. Don't take the hotel transfer from the airport (really expensive they ask 65â‚¬ but I payed with another private only 10â‚¬)

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTELâ€œClean, convenient, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: virginya
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a lovely long weekend here sightseeing in Istanbul. Located within 3 minute's walk of the stunning Blue Mosque and the other fabulous historic sites in the old city centre, ARDEN ANEX CITY Hotel is very convenient for sight seeing.The rooms are clean, the beds are comfy and the staff are lovely (MÄ°NE is especially helpful)Food was good and the restaurent service was excellent.tBreakfast was excellent with a variety of bread, cheese, olives, yogurts, fresh fruits, .... The receptionist - who made us feel at home when we arrived late at night and recommended some excellent tours for the following days.One of the most exciting things provided by the hotel is hamam - a turkish bath and spa. The woman working there -ELMAS - can literally do wonders with her bare hands. pa specialist of the highest class. We recommend to accept the service this hotel provides and try the most amazing massage in the world. As soon as we arrived, they served us some delicious Turkish tea and gave us a couple of useful maps for sightseeing while explaining how to get to all the sites from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Mohiniyattam
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hotel Arden City has been excellent. Nice room, small but very well equiped. Good breakfast buffet with variation international and local food. Fantastic friendly personel. We have been treated extremely well as well as my mother of 78 years old. The taxi service that the hotel provided was very good and friendly as well. Good organisation, very clean, good looking hote with a perfect situation: close to all important buildings to visit and in good area with friendly shop owners. We enjoyed Istambul a lot but the stay at this hotel has make it especially wonderful. Excellent

Reviews.Title: “convenient and well kept hotel at a bargain”
Reviews.Author: Nur2010
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a convenient location just up the street from Yerebatan Sarayi (the Basilica Cistern). All of the major attractions are within walking distance. The staff is pleasant and helpful, and someone replaces towels and freshens up your room everyday. Although it is in the heart of the Sultanahmet district, it is quiet at night. A full buffet breakfast (not only standard Turkish fare, but European style choices as well) is included in the cost of the room. Comparable hotels in this area charge much more than Hotel Le Piano. Some reviewers have commented on the small size of the rooms, but they are comfortable and clean. I believe most travelers will probably not spend much time in the room while in such an interesting city. I was there for 5 nights, and I plan to stay there again on my next visit to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend with Good Friends”
Reviews.Author: sjgraham
Reviews.Content: Hi - I just had 5 days in Istanbul and enjoyed a great time at "Le Piano Hotel" ... note the hotel name has change to Arden City Hotel ... and this will save you minutes of wasted time with your taxi driver. You'll save those minutes talking with the Consigeree who booked our dinner reservations and spent time advising out shopping locations ... and provided umbrella's in the rain! YES - the hotel is noisy ... you can hear the car alarms from the cars outside, but for my mind it was a great choice for 5 days of shopping, touring and socialising....a good location for Grand Bazaar and honestly the taxi are entertaining as well as transport! Don't waste your money on a tour ... just grab a taxi and tour. Thank you Le Piano ... your staff were lovely and my friends and I had a great stay ... thanks for booking our dinner reservations at Angleique ... this was a highlight! Yours taff were great.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing - bad service, but good location”
Reviews.Author: ninkyDublin
Reviews.Content: have to say i was disappointed with the Piano. A couple of things were not good: - when we arrived we could not find the hotel, we walked up and down the street and a local tried to help us out. turns out they have changed the name since we booked it, but they did not bother to leave a sign in the window or anything to make this clear. So now it is the Arden City Hotel Anex. Staff did not even apologise for this. Next thing we discovered was that the man who is in charge of the room keys (???) is away, and they canot access some of the rooms, so we have to stay a night in another hotel round the corner. Again, there was no apology, no acknowledgement that this was a pain for us, nothing. Overall the staff were not good. At breakfast, we had to keep asking for things like spoons, bowls, milk, glasses - it was a buffet, but it seemed like nothing had been replenished, so that when we came down late-ish,there were a lot of things missing off it. also the bread etc was gone stale and hard from sitting out all morning. disappointing, beause it looked like a good spread. Also, the website had said that the sauna etc were free for hotel guests to use, but when we got there, it was â‚¬20. the room itself was very nicely decorated, ditto the bathroom, with good towels, slippers, toiletries, flat TV and so on, but the room was ridiculously small. jsut enough room to walk around the bed, but nowhere to put bags, not even a chair. Got a good deal on this place with OTEL.COM, around â‚¬60, but there were dozens of other hotels on the streets all around that would probably be better, for similar money.

Reviews.Title: “too small, extremely average!”
Reviews.Author: waz24
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the rooms are extremely small! also the sleep quality is really bad...they had construction work during the day and sometimes at night, which prevented us from taking a break after long walking hours! you also suffer from people walking down stairs, coz the walls are thin...u can hear everything around u. In regards to cleanness, the rooms were all the time, but the cleaners kept leaving the windows open letting mosquitoes in (which only made our sleeping less comfortable!) Breakfast is average, not much variety to chose from.... nothing special! staff were at amazing and very helpful. Location is perfect...the best thing about this hotel...5 min away from the main attractions as well as the tramp station. Overall, i would recommend choosing another hotel if you are looking for better sleeping quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: catobleppa
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Piano is just excellent: perfect location, lovely rooms (ok they're not so big, but they're clean and comfortable, and all the furniture is very new), large showers (that does matter to me!), good breakfast, A/C, sat tv, wi-fi.... I don't stay in hotels very often, but I'd recommend it also for travelers who, like me, prefer other kind of accomodation. The only pity was that we had some problems with the reservation through hotels.com, but the stuff was extremely helpful and did their best to work it out. Over all we had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed-poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Breecardi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and I must say I was extremely disappointed. This was meant to be a highlight to our trip but instead ended up being extremely aggrivated by the very poor customer service. I had booked the hotel over the phone before we left London. I was quoted a price which i was happy with and once again rang to confirm the price and the booking and asked to pay over the phone and was told by the man that there was no need to pay I could sort it out when i arrived.After arriving by taxi myself and 4 of my friends took all of our luggage into the reception area to check in where by i was told that the price had gone up by and extra 15 euro a night per room and that the night manager had made a mistake twice and both times given us the worng price. We were told that if we could not pay that price we would have to find somewhere else. Which if they had told this to us previously we would have done. As it was peak season we had limited options of places to stay and had to fork out the extra money which we had not budgeted for the 4 nights we stayed here. The size of the hotel and the rooms is also much smaller than the pictures. The walls are very thin and and we could here people in three rooms through the walls including a crying baby. One thing I can say is the location is very close to everything and the rooms are clean however the staff need to have properly informed staff.

Reviews.Title: “Small but modern and clean room, and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Koke000
Reviews.Content: The very best of this hotel is its location. Is just 5 minutes away walking from Blue Mosque and Sta.Sophia, but in a quiet and cute area. That is imporant in a city like Istanbul. There are also restaurants in the same street and a supermarket around the corner, but it's still a peacefull neighbourhood . You need to know that the room is tiny, and also the bathroom and the wardrobe. Everything is really small, but modern. Quite well acoustic isolated, even so you can hear the call for the prayer in the morning. Apart from that, the beds are really comfortable (good latex mattress). The shower works fine, also the air conditioning. The fridge hot air is conducted to the bathroom (a great idea) so it doesn't get too hot on the room. Free wi-fi works fine. Unfortunately the staff is absolutely unhlepful, as some of them doesn't speak proper english and are not willing to help. You can book a transfer from the airport (vrey advisable if you land late) but you'll have to pay that in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Scary place to stay, like from a Hitchcock movie. Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: Mugrin
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Le Piano because 1) it was new and looked cute in the pictures, and 2) it had gotten a lot of glowing reviews on TripAdvisor during its short time in operation. I booked the room in complete confidence, and I really wish I had something nice to say, instead of what I'm about to. Let me preface this review by saying that I am a mellow, easygoing person who has traveled to hundreds of hotels all over the world, mostly for business. I'm no stranger to no-frills operations, but even without the horrifying thing that happened to me, this hotel would still have ranked at bottom of all the hotels I've ever stayed at. To wit: I arrived in Istanbul on a hot, muggy day in July, and they put me in a room (number 101) without functioning air conditioning. This, despite the fact that the hotel advertised that each room had individually-controlled AC units. Someone had apparently tried to compensate for this deficiency by putting a small fan next to the bed. Not terribly helpful. To make matters worse, only one of the two windows in the bedroom could be opened all the way. The other could only be opened a crack. The hotel did not supply sheets or blankets, as one might expect with, well, any normal hotel. Instead, the bed was covered with a single thin, scratchy bed spread that was too small to even cover the bed from end to end. The toilet paper holder fell clean out of the wall with the gentlest tug on the roll, and could not be reattached. The lights in the hallway were on power-save mode. They were programmed to turn off within two seconds of any detected movement. This meant that I had to fumble for my key card in the dark, or constantly pace back and forth in the hallway while digging through my purse, to avoid an annoying strobe-like effect. The minibar fridge didn't keep things cold. I don't usually use the minibar for snacking, but I had some medication that needed to be refrigerated, and I do use minibars for that purpose. Destroyed. Half the time, the elevator didn't seem to work. Didn't bother me much, because I was only 2 flights up. Also, there was no phone in the room. ---------------------------------------------- And this is where things really started to go south... Resigning to the fact that I was going to be hot and uncomfortable, I took a quick cold shower, opened the one functioning window, threw the bedspread aside, deadbolted the door and climbed into bed au naturelle, wrapped in a towel. I woke up a little after midnight to find the door hanging open, and a middle-aged, non-english-speaking man wandering around my room (which, as you might remember, had been deadbolted before I went to bed). I was a little disoriented, but it struck me as deeply troubling that a strange man was carrying on in my room while I'm in bed naked. I grabbed the blanket as quickly as I could to cover myself, and as I fumbled around the bed looking for something to bludgeon him with if things turned south, I asked him what the hell he was doing in my room. He said something, but not in any language I could understand. I asked him to get out. He didn't. He wandered around my room for probably less than a minute, but it felt like an eternity. Finally, when it became that he wouldn't respond to a polite request to leave, I screamed at the top of my lungs for him to get the F out of my room. Thank god, he did. I deadbolted the door again, not sure exactly what had happened, and I looked for a phone to call the front desk, but there wasn't one. I put on the clothes I had been wearing earlier that day, and walked to the front desk to ask if they could tell me why a man had shown up in my room in the middle of the night, uninvited. The concierge didn't seem to know what to do, but I just stood there telling him again and again that someone had shown up in my room while I was sleeping, and I really didn't like it. Finally, a bellhop showed up and the concierge said, "is it this guy?" I said that it was not. They talked back and forth in Turkish, and the concierge ended up telling me, by way of explanation, that the bellhop had let the strange man into my room because he had forgotten his room key somewhere, and I guess gotten our rooms mixed up since we were on the same floor. Furthermore, according to the concierge, the reason that the strange man didn't leave right away was because he was confused and thought I was his wife. I said I wanted to move to a different room because I was 1) sweltering hot and 2) really scared, but the concierge said there was no need for that, and that he would just reprogram my room lock so that no key but mine could open my door. In other words, the hotel master keys would be disabled. He must have said "please trust us" like 20 times. He couldn't seem to understand, why a young single woman, traveling alone, would have such a big problem with what had just happened to me. He kept saying "just trust us." But why? Trust has to be earned. What kind of hotel lets strangers wander into other people's rooms without double checking to see if they really belong there? What kind of hotel has doors that will open from the outside when they've been deadlocked from within? I would have left the hotel right then, but it was nearly one o'clock in the morning, no taxis in the streets, and I had no idea where else to go. So I went upstairs again, but I really can't say I slept for the rest of the night. The next morning, I went downstairs to find a different concierge, who agreed to let me change rooms. I went back to my room to find that my door key didn't work, but one of the maids passing by swiped her master key, which worked just fine. So the concierge from the night before was either a complete incompetent, or he lied to me about reprogramming the lock. Anyway, I changed rooms to one with functioning AC and windows and I stayed at the hotel for the full 3 nights I had prebooked, but I would never stay there again or recommend it to anyone else. This once-in-a-lifetime experience cost me 295 euros (3 nights). You couldn't pay me to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: BenMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, new this year. The location is fantastic: the tram, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar are all only a short walk away. Rooms are very nice but some are a little small (we saw two different ones because we changed rooms as the air conditioning broke down). Staff are very friendly and helpful and breakfast good. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & highly efficient new hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BDBSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel accomodation for Istanbul at the last minute and was shocked to find most of the highly rated hotels in Istanbul already booked. I came across Hotel Le Piano and was impressed by the 10 reviews it had obtained since opening which was relatively recently. The hotel is extremely well run by its GM: Ezgin, who runs a very efficient hotel. Staff are extremely friendly, engaging and well trained. The food at the hotel with respect to dinner was very good, breakfast was good, but lacked variety. The hotel is new, modern and very well decorated. Everything works well and rooms are of a good size. Free WiFI which works extremely well and great beds. Pity that is doesnt have a roof balcony or pool, but this is a small boutique hotel and in my mind offers fantastic value for money. The hotel is located in Sultanahmet which is very touristy, however the hotel is nicely situated about 500 metres from the busy area and is quiet at night. The hotel is perfectly located to tram services which can take you all over Istanbul. More importantly the hotel is a quick stroll from major sites, allowing you to return to them at night to take pictures or just have a stroll and enjoy them, when things are a bit quieter. I can honestly say there is nothing i didnt like about my stay and have already recommended the hotel to various friends. I would stay at Hotel Le Piano again if i returned to Istanbul. Well done to Ezgin and his staff, they are running a fantastic hotel, keep up the good standards.

HotelInfo.Name: Arden Anex City Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Alemdar mh. Prof. Kazim Ismail Gurkan cd. Num:6, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
